restaurants.name: Crowne Plaza Nairobi Airport, an IHG Hotel
Natural Oak ApartmentsOpens in new window
Deuts Four Seasons HotelOpens in new window

destinations.name: Nairobi Railway Museum
destinations.location: Adjacent to Nairobi railway station
destinations.description: Opened in 1971 it contains exhibits from the defunct East African Railways and also houses a local art centre for gifted youth to showcase their talent.

destinations.name: Nairobi Butterfly Sanctuary
destinations.location: Karen, Nairobi on the Dagoretti road next to the Karen roundabout
destinations.description: It is the largest center after the British Museum of Natural History. It boasts more than 1000 species of butterflies.

destinations.name: Bomas of Kenya
destinations.location: Langata, Nairobi
destinations.description: Experience the rich diversity of Kenya's culture  via daily cultural performances and a variety of traditional artifacts and structures.

destinations.name: Nairobi Art Gallery
destinations.location: Located at Kenyatta Avenue and Uhuru Highway roundabout next to Nyayo house
destinations.description: A fantastic little museum located at the heart of Nairobi that is dedicated to showcasing African art in its full beauty.

destinations.name: Ngong Hills
destinations.location: Located in Ngong, southwest near Nairobi
destinations.description: They are peaks in a ridge along the Great Rift Valley. Very ideal place for enjoying the outdoors and hiking either alone or with a group of friends. Enjoy birdwatching, picnicking, hiking and ziplining among other fun activities.

destinations.name: The Lord Erroll
destinations.location: located within 20 to 25 minutes drive away from the CBD, at Runda, Ruaka Road
destinations.description: Fine dining experiences in Nairobi do not come any better than this with a theme of the early 1900s, there is nothing not to love.

destinations.name: Maasai Market
destinations.location: Slip Rd, Nairobi behind the Hilton hotel at the high court parking lot
destinations.description: The open-air market sells a wide range of African antiques and has become a convergence zone for locals and tourists searchung for authentic African artisan products.

destinations.name: Panari Ice Skating Rink
destinations.location: located on the 2nd floor of the Panari Hotel on Mombasa Road
destinations.description: A large rink that can accomodate 200 skaters at any give time. Kids will fall in love with this one of a kind skating rink that also provides affordable lessons to both children and adults

destinations.name: Anselm's Kitengela Hot Glass Studio
destinations.location: Located in a planetarium dome off the beaten track on the edge of the Nairobi National Park near Ongata Rongai
destinations.description: Open 7 days a week as visitors can watch as the skilled craftsmen create blown & cast objects & make beads from recycled glass, as well as crafting changeliers among other. Enjoy an ambiance of humming creativity and bustling industry as you real, shop and soak in the natural beauty of this extraordinary place

destinations.name: Nairobi National Park
destinations.location: Located about 7-10 km south of the Nairobi City Centre
destinations.description: Wide open grass plains and backdrop of the city scrapers, scattered acacia bush play host to a wide variety of wildlife including the endangered black rhino and over 400 recorded species of diverse birdlife. The walking trails and picnic sites are just to die for.

destinations.name: Karen Blixen Museum
destinations.location: Karen Rd, Nairobi
destinations.description: It not only provides the most comprehensive insight into the persona of Karen Blixen but also offers a fantastic space for personal reflection in our nature trail against a back drop of Karen's beloved Ngong Hills

destinations.name: Hell's Gate National Park
destinations.location: Lies south of Lake Naivasha.About 2 hours drive to the north west of Nairobi.
destinations.description: Named for the intense geothermal activity within its boundaries cemintifying itself as a remarkable quarter of the Great Rift Valley. The spectacular scenery that includes the towering cliffs, water-gouged gorges, stark rock towers abd belching plumes of geothermal steam make it one of the most atmospheric Parks in Africa.

destinations.name: Giraffe Center
destinations.location: Located in Langata, Duma Rd approximately 20kilometres from the centre of Nairobi.
destinations.description: The place plays a vital role in conserving the critically endangered Rothschild giraffe. It is quite a place to meet the tallest mammal which serve as a main attraction for both school children and visitors who get to feed the magnificent creatures.

destinations.name: Kenyatta International Conference Centre
destinations.location: Harambee Avenue City Square Nairobi
destinations.description: Feel top of the world at KICC, a place for people that love to stargaze and watch the sun sink down the western horizon. You will get the best bird's eye view of Nairobi in all her glory. Only when you are on the rooftop do you realise just how big Nairobi is.

destinations.name: David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust
destinations.location: The Nairobi Nursery, is in Nairobi National Park (KWS Central Workshop Gate on Magadi Road).
destinations.description: They are best known for their work on protecting elephants while operating the most successful orphan elephant rescue and rehabilitation program in the world. They also dub in the rescue and raising of rhinos and so much more.

destinations.name: Maasai Mara National Reserve
destinations.location: It is located 224km away from the capital Nairobi in Narok County
destinations.description: It is one of the largest game reserves in Kenya, widely considered to be Africa's greatest wildlife reserve. Contiguous with the plains of the Serengeti, the Mara is home to a breathtaking array in life commonly known for the 'big five'

destinations.name: Karura Forest
destinations.location: Located in the nothern part of Nairobi city. The main entrance is on Limuru Road, after the Belgian Embassy.
destinations.description: The Karura Forest Reserve is an urban upland forest on the outskirts of Nairobi, the capital of Kenya. This remarkable geographical location and natural resource is one of the largest gazetted forests in the world fully within a city limits.

destinations.name: Oloolua Nature Trail
destinations.location: Oloolau Forest, Karen Rd, Nairobi
destinations.description: The Oloolua forest is the home to the Institute of Primate Researcg has an established 5km trail that provides an oasis of tranquility that invites a barrage of visitiors. It has all the elements of a fantasy that include but are not limited to a 20 foot waterfall, a cave and a picnic site overlooking a river.

destinations.name: Maasai Ostrich Farm & Resort
destinations.location: It is located 45km from Nairobi on the Athi River/Kitengela plains on the outskirts of a town called Kitengela.
destinations.description: It is East Africa's largest commercial hub for ostrich farming. It is quite the opportunity to get personal with ostriches and even get an opportunity to ride one at an affordable price. One canot forget the quiet garden setting and the pool after an afternoon of touring the entire site.

destinations.name: Mamba Village
destinations.location: North Langata, Nairobi
destinations.description: It is the largest crocodile farm in Africa and is home to over 1000 crocodiles both young and mature. The botanical garden sets the mood just before interacting with one of the most interesting animals in the animal kingdom in their natural habitat. This experience is breathtaking as it gives you a one on one interaction with the wild. It is also home to BIG DADD, the oldest crocodile.
